content.description: Start Matched on the left side of the big jug rail just to the right of the Arete. Gain a very high left heel (at or above hands), and pull straight to the jugs above. Significantly easier than it's neighbor, which utilizes a hold on the face to move up and right.
content.location: About 15' behind the left side of Pulpit rock on the small overhang

content.description:
A cool powerful line.

 Start sitting down in the hole on the obvious huge jug rail. Now figure out how to hit the jugs on the lip before topping out with a long move to a good top to hold.

 Beta video: youtube.com/watch?v=C6H2CEv…
content.location: Walk to the left of Pulpit Rock, when you get to the end of it, this line is about 10 -15 feet further up the trail on the left.

content.description:
Start on the sharp quartz jug with your left and right in a pocket in the seam. Pick some feet, pull out right to a good crimp before tossing your hand up to a jug below the lip. Top out up and too the left.

 Good movement, just too short.

 Beta Video: youtube.com/watch?v=QDpxRzs…
content.location: Start on the obvious sharp jug on the lip of boulder and a pocket with the right.

content.description:
Start on the jug in the middle of the face (this is also the starting left hand for "Unionize"). Pull on and traverse the lip left to top out for Wage Slaves.

 Beta Video: youtube.com/watch?v=K36UcPX…
content.location: Starts on the sharp jug in the middle of the face.

content.description:
Start as for Working Man Blues and climb through the crux of that route to the jugs at the lip. From here move right through the sloper and up the arete using a big sidepull on the arete and top out easily in the notch.

 Beta Video: youtube.com/watch?v=gxJoOW8…
content.location: Shared start with Wage Slaves and tops out as for Unionize

content.description: This is a great little overhanging face with a number of quality lines.
